resources.string: Reflux tackles the problems that the industries and the society face that can be solved through major breakthroughs in chemical engineering. Students will come up with such solutions at Reflux.

Many environmetal and industrial problems have their solutions hidden somewhere in the books of Chemical Engineering. One such problem that is both industrial as well as environmetal, is the coalfields in Jharia, Bihar which have been on fire for the past 98 years. We invite all the chemical engineers to put their intelligence and knowledge in use to find out the most feasible and plausible idea which might also become the solution to these ever-burning fire at Jharia which has claimed innumerous lives in the district of Jharia along with depriving India of more than 4billion $ worth of coal deposits
Innovation requires the ability to collaborate and share ideas with people and the courage to challenge the old dogma and the conventional wisdom.

We here at Techmart believe that innovation and courage lie at the very heart of entrepreneurship and we strive to kick start the chain reaction of transformation of ideas into real materialistic success. The motto of this year’s Techmart is “Startup India, Standup India”. It is a fortunate co-incidence that our goal aligns with the latest government schemes of promoting entrepreneurship among young engineers with innovative ideas. India needs a fresh minted idea that will start a revolution and turn India into a major manufacturing power. Techmart’15 provides a platform to showcase such innovation.

While work on rockets that will get us to our red neighbor , whose allure as an otherworldly destination and potential host of alien life has deckoned scientists and dreamers for thousand of years, they are also thinking hard about how to build a sustainable colony on Mars. And since there is only so much space and weight on the rockets that will propel to mars, we need innovative solutions, not just solutions available today, but solutions from years in the future when those Mars rockets will be ready.
Maintaining a colony on the Red Planet will prove to be a Leviathan challenge, compounded by the knowledge that should a catastrophe occur, “Help is only 140 million miles away”.

AD-WAR requires the participants to be creative and develop a marketing strategy for a product of their choice. Students will perform an advertisement and thus present their advertising idea. The best idea will bag the title of the ADKING.

Complexomania is a twist in engineering. Instead of solving a problem, complexomania asks the participants to introduce a complexity in it. A problem statement must be achieved in the most complex way for the participant to win the competition.

Everything, anything, can be explained through a science that lurks in the nature. Through TATVA, we will discover the science behind materials, elements, their origins, their extraction, their applications. A series of tests will be put forward as challenges in front of the participants to test their knowledge in the field of metallurgy and material sciences.
Tatvarequires the students to have an advanced understanding of metallurgical processes. Students will face challenges related to Metallurgical science and Engineering in a series of competitions.

The spelling bee competition initiates students into a world of competitive learning, acting as an invaluable tool for language improvement. The healthy competitive spirit motivates the students to learn on their own without compulsion. The game and activity based nature of the competition ensures the students rapt attention and utilize their aspirations for winning games.
A classic spelling bee competition that will ask the students to hone their vocabulary and spell and pronounce the given words correctly.

“Ingenium”, the Latin for Talent, explores deep into students to find out their hidden talents in various competitive rounds. The finalists will perform in front of a panel of Judges who choose the winner based on the performances.

A competitive programming challenge based on algorithms that tests the participant’s ability to code as quickly as possible and deliver the required output. The fulfilment of all the objectives in the least time decide the winner.

The film festival of UIET Kanpur, SHOWBUZZ explores the artisticminds among engineers. The participants are required to shoot, direct and act in a short movie serving a noble cause that will be projected in front of an audience comprising of young students. The creativity and director skills in the movie will decide the winner.

Participants will go through a series of filtering challenges including group discussions and personal interviews. HITZ requires the participants to hone their communication skills in order to claim the title of Mr./Ms.HITZ.
One of the biggest crowd pullers, Quizomania is a team quiz that tests lateral thinking capacity.
A competition of creating the perfect projectiles through self made rockets that work on hydraulics principles. fulfilments of the specific rules by the projectile hit will decide the winner.
FIFA, Counter Strike, NFS Most Wanted! Enough Said!
A competition where students will design electronic circuits on bread boards to perform various objectives given to them.
Research on Engineering and Advanced non Conventional Technology

Team of 3–6 members will present their product and convince through their act showing how powerful is their salability quotient. They must show a product in the act relating to their object of portrayal. The maximum time that will be allotted to each team for their act is 5 minutes.

The teams that are selected move forward to this round comprises of viva slogan round. Each team will be asked 10–15 slogans. The best 6 teams of Round-II will move to Round-III. In case of a tie, a tie-breaker slogan will be asked, and the team that answers first moves to the next round. In case the team that answers first, do so incorrectly, the other team advances. A maximum time of 30 seconds will be given to the teams for each question. If the team fails to answer the question within the given time limit, the question will pass.

The best 6 teams that enter the final round will be given a product impromptu. They will be given a preparation time of 20 minutes to prepare their act. The act must have a runtime of 3–5 minutes. The teams that fail to report with their act within the 20 minutes prep time will be disqualified. The teams that fail to reach the venue will also be disqualified. The judges will decide the Top 3 winners from the acts that are presented in the final round.
A shield will be awarded to the team leader. Certificates to each member with cash prize.
A silver medal and certificate to each members of the team with Cash prize.
A bronze medal and certificate to each members of the team with cash prizes.

Code-Trek is the programming Contest of UIET Kanpur, organized by the TechMart team. It is a prestigious programming contest where each coder whacks his brain to code solutions to the given problems. It is the place where optimization and proficiency matters, skills matter, hard work matters, trying till the very end matters and winning loads of cash prizes matter.
Code-Trek is an on-the-spot programming competition. The event unfolds in 2 rounds:
•\tA preliminary written round to test your basic programming skills.
•\tThe test paper will consist of Aptitude and basic Coding questions.
•\tQualified teams can participate in this round only.
•\tThis round will consist of a practical competition in CSE Advanced Lab
•\tA team can consist of at most 3 members.
•\tOnly teams of which all members are students currently registered in a university shall be eligible for prizes. However, non-students are also welcome to participate.
•\tTop 10 teams will qualify for the II round
•\tPermissible languages are C, C++, Pascal, Python and Java
•\tCompilers to be used: gcc-4.3.2 for C, g++-4.3.2 for C++, fpc-2.2.4 for pascal, python-2.5 for Python and javac-1.6.0_12 for Java.
•\tSolutions have to give the correct output for all the test data for a given problem to be deemed correct. There is no partial credit.
•\tAny team found to be indulging in any form of malpractice will be immediately disqualified.
•\tThe decision of the organizers in declaring the results will be final. No queries in this regard will be entertained.
•\tA brief introduction in 5 lines in which the candidate has to describe their own self (at the start of group discussion)
•\tA round of group discussions (5 candidates at a time).
•\tFiltration will be done by the coordinating team.
•\tCredit point to the candidate who initiates the discussion
•\tClarity of speech, postures, selection of words, temperament.
•\t10 Girls and 10 Boys will be filtered after round-1
•\tA situation will be given to each candidate to which they will be supposed to give a tactful and feasible reaction.
This being the final deciding round, will be judged by the panel composing of faculty members only.
The winners will be awarded the title of Mr.Hitz and Ms.Hitz. \nCash prizes worth Rs 3000 shared by both winners with certificate of excellence and sash with gift hampers.

Department of Chemical Engineering, UIET Kanpur is proud to present its Technical event REFLUX. We call it our annual celebration of the spirit of Chemical Engineering rather than just a Technical Festival. It holds the motto of promoting science and technology, scientific thinking, and innovation in the field of Chemical Engineering. \nREFLUX provides an opportunity to all the budding chemical engineers to compete, exchange ideas, collaborate and learn and of course have fun all under the same roof.

SHOWBUZZ, UIET’s own film festival motivates the top storytellers let their ideas flow freely on the moving storyboard. It’s the platform for next Arunabh Kumar and Biswapati Sarkar to firm their feet into the field. SHOWBUZZ is one event which brings all the technical and creative talents in one reel and gives a screen to project the works of the best directors, video editors, audio mixers, storytellers, actors, and etcetera. \n“A camera in one hand and a good script in the other makes it possible for storytelling to come to life. Sometimes the stories are already in our minds and we have the entire scenes worked out, but they never come out. SHOWBUZ lets the doors wide open.\n” So gather your gear, and start capturing the imagination into the lenses.

•	The participants must carry their registration slip to the event venue. Participation will not be allowed without proof of registration.
•	The movies should not have a runtime of more than 15 minutes an less than 10 minutes. 
•	The movie making team must not contain more than 6 members. There can be any number of actors but the credits must include only the original movie making team. 
•	The movie must not contain any explicit content that can be harmful to society. 
•	The movies should not contain or promote any kind of unethical behavior. 
•	Violence, blood and foul language is strictly prohibited. 
•	Movies can be of any genre. 
•	One team can submit more than one movie but each movie must be registered separately. 
•	The movies must be submitted digitally only in (.mp4) format 
•	Originality will be appreciated 
•	The movies must be submitted before or at 5:00 PM on 19th November, Thursday. 
•	The decision of the event coordinators and the judges will be final.
The movies will be evaluated based on the following criteria:

•	Title of the movie- The title of the movie should be descriptive an no longer than 5 words. 
•	Direction 
•	Plot of the movie 
•	Acting 
•	Sound and visual effects
The event coordinators will judge all the submitted movies and the best 5 movies will be played in front of the UIET audience and a panel of judges in lecture hall- 1.
All the registered teams will participate. A team can have a 2 or 3 members.
•\tParticipants will be presented with crosswords puzzles. \n•\tNo negative markings \n•\tNumber of questions asked:20

•	A series of questions will be presented to all the participating teams and the answers will be recorded on the paper by one of the team members. 
•	+2 for each correct answer. 
•	-1 for each wrong answer. 
•	Number of questions asked--->30
Six teams from the screening round will qualify for the Tatva main event. \nDay-2 will have 4 rounds in a span of 1 hours 30 minutes.

•	A 10 seconds video clip will be shown to each team and a question will be asked based on that clip. 
•	Each correct answer carries 20 marks. 
•	If a team fails to answer the question prompted to them, the question will not be passed to any other team. 
•	No negative markings.

•	Each team will be presented with a question. 
•	Hints can be asked for. Every time a hint is asked for, the reward of the question decreases. 
•	Without Clue-------> 40 marks 
•	1st clue---------------> 30 marks 
•	2nd clue--------------> 20 marks 
•	3rd Clue--------------> 10 marks 
•	Once a clue has been asked for, the teams will be awarded negative points in case of no or wrong answer.

•	Colours will be shown on the screen. Each colour will have a specific question and specific points hidden behind it. 
•	There will be four bonus colours with extra marks hidden behind them. 
•	There is no negative marking for ordinary colours which carry a question of 10 marks 
•	Bonus colours carry questions with 40 marks but there will be a risk of losing 10 points in case of wrong answer. 
•	Bonus questions cannot be passed.

•\t10 consecutive questions will be asked to each team. \n•\tEvery question will carry 10 marks. \n•\tTeams can decide to skip a question but in case of a wrong answer all the marks obtained via previous questions of the round will be wiped out
Here is your chance to prove mettle as an innovation engineer and show the world how miraculous adding a few strings to the construction of a popsicle bridge with glue can be.
•\tTeam registration are invited only\n•\tA team of 3 to 5 members is allowed
A team will be taken based on basic mechanics

Selected teams will have to design a cable stayed suspension bridge using popsicle sticks, cotton string and fevicol that can sustain the maximum possible load with minimum deflection satisfying the understated constraints.
1st Prize: 1500 Rs.\n2nd Prize: 1000 Rs.\n3rd Prize: 500 Rs.
•\t1 day event (2 hours approx for model making, 15 to 20 minutes for quiz)\n•\tCertificates to all the participants.\n•\tEquipments needed for the model will be provided.
A team of 4 or 5 members will be given a task and clues, roaming around the campus the team completion the task in minimum time will come up as a winner.
•\tA team is to be registered (Individual participants are not allowed).\n•\tTeam must have 4 or 5 members minimum and maximum 6 members.
A 3 round event, treasure will be disclosed in 3rd round.
1st Prize (Treasure): 2000 Rs.\n2nd Prize: 1000 Rs.\n3rd Prize: 500 Rs.

•	One day Event
•	Needs 2 hours approx
•	Certificates to all the participants (2nd round onwards)
•	Medals and Shields to winners.
The event tests how much participants is conscious about what is going around the globe. Event comprises of screening and buzzer round, 4 or 5 teams are advanced to final round.
•\tYou can register as a team only.\n•\tA team of 3 to 5 members will be considered.\n•\tRegistration fee: 40 Rs. per head.
All the registered team will answer 20 questions asked to them through PPT, or orally.
•\tTwo day event (one round each day).\n•\tCertificates will be given to all the 2nd round participants and medals to winners.
TECHMART (UIET-KANPUR) is pleased to announce a photography contest for school / college students. Open to all, here is a chance to showcase your work.
RULES OF THE PHOTO CONTEST FOCUS (PIXELS):

•	By submitting any entry to this contest, you accept these terms and conditions.
•	THEME: SELFIE WITH WATER and CANDID PHOTOGRAPHY. Shoot anything that represents water and real life moment.
•	FORMAT FOR SUBMISSION:
(i) Each participant may submit up to 2 photos from each category. No photo may be more than 5 MB in size 
(ii) Merited entries will register for the Final round where they will be asked to click a photograph based on a theme which will be unveiled impromptu and submit the same to the event coordinator within 30 minutes of unveiling of the theme. 
•	HOW TO SUBMIT: 
Send the images by email to sandeep.bhargava@rocketmail.com OR Whatsapp +918802727423 with the subject line: Photo Contest. Each email may have only one photo. In the main body of the email, enter the following details: Name, Date of Birth, Email, Contact Tel / Mobile, School / College, Grade / Class / Year, Caption for Photo.
•	WHO MAY PARTICIPATE? 
The contest is open to students from schools and colleges all over India. Management, owners, employees and the family members.
•	DEADLINE FOR SUBMISSIONS: 
11:59 p.m. on November 17, 2015, Indian Standard Time. The organizers reserve the right to extend the contest duration by a period of not more than 15 days. Entries received after the submission deadline will not be considered. UIET will not be responsible for any entries delayed or lost in transit. UIET reserves the right to cancel the competition at any time, without prior notification or obligation, for any reason.
Final round participants shall be given Certificate by the University and the winners will be suitably rewarded.

Shortlisted images will be judged by an eminent panel comprising those who understand and appreciate the art of photography, and will base their opinion on pure merit only. The final results will be declared on 20th November after contest deadline ends. The decision of the judges will be final and binding on all participants.
ALL MERIT ENTRIES MAY FEATURE ON tech-mart.in:

Participants will have to give their consent for their entries to be posted on techmart.com on any related accounts or sections set up on Flickr, Facebook, Google+ and other social media and image sharing websites.. Entries may be posted at any stage of the competition and will be open for anyone to see. Suitable credit will be given. Participants have the option to have their one line bio, contact information and web / blog address to be given in the credit line.

All submissions must be genuine photographic images that are recognizable and not a completely created image. Digital retouching is allowed though restricted solely to simple colour correction and cropping. Digitally manipulated images will be disqualified. Images need not be digital, and can be sent as scanned images. The participants are required to submit their www.exifdata.com (This site gives you the information about every detail of your picture) screenshot on the above specified e-mail id. All work must be original. Contest participants must affirm that submissions are their original work and that they are the holder of the copyright or that they have the right to copyright any and all photographs submitted to this contest.
For More Information, NEWS and Updates Visit: www.tech-mart.in
"The word that we have created as a result of the level of thinking we have done thus far, creates problems that cannot be solved at the same level of thinking at which we create them."
Research in Engineering and Advanced non Conventional Technology (R.E.A.C.T) is a platform for the young pioneer of Engineering.To review these researches, find application for the same.
Submission of review papers.\nParticipants must email their review papers to "reactintechmat@gmail.com" with their registration number.
Presentation\nThe finalists will be called to explain their review papers in front of the judges along with a powerpoint presentation.

•	The review papers must be completely original. Contact from internet can be considered as source but a copy will not be entertained.
•	Participants must submit their review papers along with their name and registration number through email at "reactintechmart@gmail.com".
•	The deadline for submission is 2:00 PM, 8th November 2015.
•	Participants need to submit a hard copy of their review paper to the student coordinator by 8th November
•	Participants need to mention the reference from where they have taken the data.

•	Leap Motion
•	Virtual Reality
•	Automatic Air Suspension System
•	Alcohol as Alternative fuel in I.C Engines
•	Cloud Computing
•	Cyber Security
•	Fuel Cell Technology
•	Radioactive Waste Management
•	Signal & Image Processing
•	Wireless Communication & Mobile Computing
•	Low Power VLSI Design
•	Survival Strategies on Mars

All submitted review papers will be screened by the Technical Committee and the merited participants will be forwarded to final round of the presentation where the finalists will present their review paper in front of the Technical Committee with the help of a powerpoint presentation.

Authors of the review papers will have to register on or before 5:00 PM, 8 November 2015\nParticipant fee: Rs. 100\-\nThe participants must submit a soft copy as well as a hard copy of the review paper at the time of registration. The soft copy must be through an email to "reactintechmart@gmail.com".

•	Last Date for submission of Full Paper: 8 November 2015
•	Last Date for Registration of the Author: 8 November 2015
•	Notification on Selection of Papers: 16 November 2015
•	Event Date: 20 November 2015
Total prize worth 6000 Rs. to be shared by all the winners.

Fire up your fellow students, assemble a team of rocket scientists, bombard your science teacher until she or he registers! Come have a blast-off and launch your summer in style!\nAnd hey, it really is rocket science.

Pioneers event is about startup idea. Participants get their hands dirty and put theories to the test by collaborating with like-minded. It’s important to remember that it’s not just about framing the idea—it’s about the how to achieve that idea ,it’s about the right team that solve real-world problems.
There will be two rounds; participants selected in round1will pitch their idea in second round.
Hardcopy of idea has to be submitted by participants on/before 19th November.\nIdea may be presented by from any category mentioned below-

•	Developer-
Ruby On Rails , PHP ,Google Developers ,Java developers ,.NET ,CSS, Android Developer, iPhone Developer, iPad Developer, Python, JQuery, Drupal, Django, Silverlight, Dreamweaver, HTML, WordPress, Cloud ComputingWeb Design / Refresh
•	Designer
•	Business/non-technical
A participant may have different idea from above mentioned category.

Teams form organically around the ideas and the selected team will carry on 2nd round.
Maximum Four teams from the 1st round will qualify for the Pioneer main event.
Participants have to pitch their idea to judges.
Maximum time each participating team/individual can take-20min.
Total time duration for 4 teams-1hr 20min

The idea will be evaluated based on the following criteria:
•	Customer Validation :
Are teams building something that people actually want? How well does the team understand their customer and their customer’s needs?
•	Execution and Design
Have they established a minimum viable product , such as software or hardware, etc.? Did they build the minimum set of features needed to start collecting data? Does it deliver a compelling and captivating user experience? Were they able to demo something functional?
•	Business Model Validation
How does the team plan on making this a successful business? Have they thought about (either solved or identified problems) competition, how to scale, acquiring customers, their revenue model etc? How will they acquire their first 100 customers?

•	Idea should be presented in A4 sheet can be hand written or printed.
•	The idea should not be more than 750 words( 3 A4 sheets).
•	Team size 1–3.
•	The content should not contain or promote any kind of unethical behavior.
•	A team/participant can submit more than one idea but must be registered separately.
•	Originality will be appreciated.
•	The idea must be submitted before or at 5:00 PM on 19th November, Thursday.
•	Presentation at/on 19th November, Friday.
•	Venue- IT seminar hall.
•	Participant may use PPT slides for presentation.
•	The decision of the event coordinators and the judges will be final.
•\tParticipation certificate will be provided to each participant.\n•\tWinner Prize money - (will be declared on event date ) and Winning certificate

Lan gaming is the most wanted event of techmart for gamers and also who are looking for fun. With multiplayer gaming, the fun of gaming is not only evovled but increased manifolds. Lan_Gaming organized under the techfest of UIET, Techmart, comprises of 3 games and and is a 2 day event.
No One Can Stop You Once You Are Determined To Win The Race
1.\tNeed for Speed Most Wanted.\n2.\tFIFA 2011\n3.\tCounter Strike Condition Zero

On very first day of techmart, gamers will take part and winners for each round in each game will be decided on the spot. Winners qualified for the final round will then compete for the first place in final round on next day.
Final round will be organized on last day of the event and techmart. This round will decide the final winners for each game.
Only winner will be awarded with the prize.

•	Each team of Counter Strike and FIFA will comprise of only 4 players, not less than this and not more than this.
•	Maximum of 4 players will be playing NFS MW at a time.
•	Any player caught in malpractice will be disqualified immediately.
•	Winner will be decided by the co-ordinator or deputy co-ordinators, and that will be final. Participant will have to accept that decision. No participant can claim the decision to be wrong as it will not be entertained no matter what.

A specific range of the water rocket will be tested in this round. The rocket has to hit a provided target range marked on the ground as concentric circles. The centre of the circles lies at a distance of 50 m from the launch point.

The water rocket can be launched from launch pad with any suitable angle as per your convenience and would be tested for maximum time of flight. Water rockets with boosters are also allowed in this round. Multi-staging mechanism can also be implemented with or without boosters.

The arena for the first round consists of 3 concentric circles. The centre of the circles lies at a distance of 50 m from the launch point. The circular arena is divided into 3 regions.
Region 1 – Circle of radius 1 .
Region 2 – Ring of inner radius 1 m and outer radius 2 m with same centre as circle A.
Region 3 – Ring of inner radius 2 m and outer radius 3 m with same centre as circle A.

•	The team will be disqualified in case the bottle bursts while pressurizing and still mounted on the launcher.
•	Participants are allowed to use separate models for round one and two but the same model has to be used throughout a given round.
•	Changes will be highlighted on the website and will also be mailed to all the registered participants. However, you are suggested to keep checking the website regularly.
•	The Aero-model being used in this Competition cannot be used in any other Competition being organized in TECHMART`13
•	A team can consist of maximum 4 members. Students from different colleges can form a team.
•\tAny student of any academic institution is eligible to participate\n•\tThe organizers reserve all rights to change any or all of the above rules.

•	The circular arena is divided into 3 concentric circular regions with radius of 1m, 2m and 3m.
•	The object placed at centre holds 300 points
•	The inner Region A (radius 1 m) holds 200 points.
•	The next Region B (radius 1–2 m) holds 125 points.
•	The last Region C (radius 2–3m) holds 75 points.
•	NO points will be awarded if the water rocket lands outside the arena.
•	The position of the rocket will be the first point of impact of the rocket on the ground.
•	First round is the qualification round.
•	In event of any clash of final points a tiebreaker will be held between the concerned teams. The clashing teams will have to go through round 1 until the points differ.
•	The team with greater score will be awarded superior rank.
•	Top 10 teams will make their way to the second round.

•	A stopwatch will be used to measure the time of flight. The duration shall include the time when the rocket is launched and until it touches the ground in the first instance. The time for the motion of the rocket after touching the ground once is not included.
•	Bonus 10 seconds will be added in the final time for water rocket with boosters or multi-staging. Multi-staging along with boosters will earn15 extra seconds.
•	However, it must be clearly understood that these bonus time will be awarded only on successful functioning of the mechanisms. This will be judged by the organising authority here.
•	Successful Functioning for boosters is their (all of them) detachment from the main stage and further propulsion of the main stage after that.
•	Successful Functioning for multi-stage is the separation of the various stages at different intervals.
•	All decisions taken by the organising team will be deemed as final.

•	In the first round 3 chances will be provided out of which 1st will be a trial. The sum of last two chances will be the counted in the score.
•	It is upon the participant to choose the given turn as a trial or official turn mentioning it beforehand. No points will be awarded for the trial.
•	Participants will be allowed to launch their model at most 3 times in second round out of which only 2 will be considered for the final judging. The other one will be a trial.
•	Only water and air can be used as propellants.
•	It is not compulsory for the participants to bring their own launchers. Either they can use their own launchers or the launcher provided by organizers.
•	Water Rocket and any of its components should be handmade. Readymade models are strictly not allowed.
•	Your model can be of any size or shape and can be made of any material. But, it should not damage the arena or hurt any person. If your model is found dangerous, you will not be allowed to participate in the event.
•	The water rocket may contain any of the following mechanisms suitable for different rounds
•	Water Rocket with Parachute mechanism.
•	Water rocket with booster mechanism. In this case, participants should ensure that they have proper launchers supporting the launching mechanism.
•	Multi-stage rocket for extended time of flight.
•	Water rocket with radio control mechanism.
•	Any other innovative mechanism will be encouraged provided that the material and mechanism used is not harmful or dangerous to any person in the field. In this case the decision of the panel of coordinators will be final and no queries will be entertained in this regard.
The ECE department of UIET brings the first event of Robotics that will make the robots race against each other.

•	Robot must be wireless and move on wheels. The bot must not jump over any area of the arena.
•	Dimensions of the bot(40x40x15) cm
•	The arena will consist of different obstacles (concrete, mud, water, fire, sharp turns, and narrow straits). The obstacles will be placed with the maximum size of the bots in consideration.
•	The bots must have a DC motor and must work on a DC battery.
•	Only team registration will be entertained.
•	A team must comprise of 5–7 members.
•\tRobots will have to cross the arena in the minimum possible time.\n•\tIf the robot causes any type of destruction in the arena, the participant will be disqualified.
Registration fees: Rs 60/- per head \nThe decision of the coordinators and the judges will be final.

•\tThe event will comprise of a simple game of pick and place with just one exception, your bot has to do it.\n•\tRobots have to pick square and round shaped structures from one side of the arena to the other side avoiding all the hurdles.\n•\tThe structures must be placed in such a way that they form the given design.

•	The robot can be wired or wireless.
•	The robot must move in the arena using miniature tank tracks (chained wheels).
•	Robots must not skip any area on the arena
•	Robots must not damage the arena in any manner. In case the robot damages the arena, the participant will be disqualified.
•	Maximum size of the robot must be in dimensions of 35x35x40 cm
•	Only team registrations will be entertained
•	A team may comprise of 5–7 members
There will be two rounds:\n1.\tKnockout round\n2.\tFinal round
Each team will be allotted a time limit to finish the task.
‘Watch the bots create “o jogo bonito”’\nIt is basically a soccer/football that will be played between two teams for a finite time.

•	Each team can have a maximum of 5–7 members
•	Each team must have three bots: Two small (players), One big (goal keeper)
•	The goal keeper must be efficient enough to destroy the opponent player bots that arrive towards the goal
•	Dimension of the small bots must be 15x15x15cm
•	Dimensions of the big (goalkeeper) bots must be 60x60x60 cm
•	Weight limit for the player bot and the goalkeeper bot must be 2 kg and 30 kg respectively

There will be two rounds
•	Knockout round
•	Final round 
1.	Each gameplay will be of 5 minutes.
2.	Points will be given according to the no. of goals and destruction made by the goalkeeper to the opponent team bots.
The bot will be a LFR (Line Following Robot) that has to follow a given design of black line on white background.

•	The bot has to be line follower
•	Bot has to follow black line on a white background
•	In case the bot loses the grid, the participant will be disqualified
•	In case all the participants lose the grid, the participant whose bot will cover the maximum distance without distraction will be declared as the winner
•	Only team registrations will be entertained
•	A team must comprise of 4–5 members
Bot completing the given grid of black line over a white background in the minimum time will be the winner.
An aptitude based quiz on topics related to general reasoning, computer programming and general mathematics, basic electrical engineering.

Circuit Designing on Multisim
We will analyse basically on the candidate’s ability to do maximum task in minimum period of time.
Points will be rewarded after each round and the winner will be decided on the basis of overall points scored in round 1 and round 2
Any decision made by the coordinators and the judges will be final.
